title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0115

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to another lesson with us at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一节课。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And I'm Erica.
segments.cn: 我是Erica。

segments.en: And today we don't feel very good.
segments.cn: 今天我们感觉不太好。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Actually, in this lesson we're talking about a hangover.
segments.cn: 实际上，在这节课中我们要谈论宿醉。

segments.en: A hangover.
segments.cn: 宿醉。

segments.en: Wow, that's an interesting word.
segments.cn: 哇，这是个有趣的词。

segments.en: What does that mean?
segments.cn: 这是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, when you drink beer or wine or vodka and you drink too much of it, the next morning you have a hangover.
segments.cn: 嗯，当你喝啤酒、葡萄酒或伏特加，喝得太多，第二天早上你就会宿醉。

segments.en: Okay, so a lot of our listeners have probably experienced the hangover before.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们的很多听众可能都经历过宿醉。

segments.en: It's very likely.
segments.cn: 很有可能。

segments.en: But the problem is when you have to go to work the next day.
segments.cn: 但问题是你第二天必须上班。

segments.en: Yes, and you might need to actually miss work, but you need some good words and phrases to describe how bad you feel.
segments.cn: 是的，你可能真的需要请假，但你需要一些好的词汇和短语来描述你有多糟糕。

segments.en: Okay, so let's listen to this dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们第一次听这个对话。

segments.en: We have a guy describing his hangover and why he missed work that day.
segments.cn: 我们有一个家伙在描述他的宿醉，以及他为什么那天缺勤。

segments.en: Are you okay, man?
segments.cn: 你还好吗，兄弟？

segments.en: You don't look very well.
segments.cn: 你看起来不太好。

segments.en: I feel terrible.
segments.cn: 我感觉糟透了。

segments.en: I went out last night with Trevor and things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 我昨晚和Trevor出去，事情有点失控。

segments.en: Nice.
segments.cn: 不错。

segments.en: So where did you guys go?
segments.cn: 那你们去了哪里？

segments.en: We hit up a couple of local bars and met up with some friends.
segments.cn: 我们去了几家当地酒吧，见了一些朋友。

segments.en: Everything was cool until Mike came along.
segments.cn: 一切都很好，直到Mike来了。

segments.en: And it turned out that it was his birthday yesterday.
segments.cn: 结果发现昨天是他的生日。

segments.en: Oh no!
segments.cn: 哦不！

segments.en: Mike's birthday is a drink fest for sure.
segments.cn: Mike的生日绝对是个饮酒狂欢。

segments.en: Tell me about it.
segments.cn: 说得对。

segments.en: We drank everything in the bar.
segments.cn: 我们喝光了酒吧里的所有酒。

segments.en: Is that why you missed work today?
segments.cn: 这就是你今天缺勤的原因吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I woke up this morning feeling really nauseous.
segments.cn: 是的，我今天早上醒来感觉非常恶心。

segments.en: I threw up like five times.
segments.cn: 我呕吐了五次。

segments.en: Ew!
segments.cn: 呃！

segments.en: I was so dehydrated that I drank a gallon of water and my head has been pounding all day.
segments.cn: 我脱水得厉害，喝了一加仑水，头痛了一整天。

segments.en: I swear, I am never going to drink again.
segments.cn: 我发誓，我再也不喝了。

segments.en: Too bad, man.
segments.cn: 真可惜，兄弟。

segments.en: Tonight is Tracy's going away party and she asked if you were going to go.
segments.cn: 今晚是Tracy的告别派对，她问你会不会去。

segments.en: Oh yeah?
segments.cn: 哦，是吗？

segments.en: I'm there.
segments.cn: 我会去的。

segments.en: Alright, so he's never drinking again, but then at the next chance for a party, he's already ready to go.
segments.cn: 好吧，他说再也不喝了，但在下一个派对的机会来临时，他已经准备好了。

segments.en: I think that's the typical lie of every person that drinks.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是每个喝酒的人典型的谎言。

segments.en: They say, I'll never drink again, but a week later or a month later, they are again.
segments.cn: 他们说，我再也不喝了，但一周后或一个月后，他们又喝了。

segments.en: Or a day later.
segments.cn: 或者一天后。

segments.en: Alright, so we saw some great vocab here, so let's look at it now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们看到了一些很棒的词汇，现在让我们在语言收获中看看。

segments.en: Language Takeaway We're going to look at five words here.
segments.cn: 语言收获 我们将看五个词。

segments.en: Now, the first one, they talked about how Mike's birthday is a drink fest.
segments.cn: 首先，他们谈到Mike的生日是个饮酒狂欢。

segments.en: A drink fest.
segments.cn: 饮酒狂欢。

segments.en: It's a drink fest.
segments.cn: 这是个饮酒狂欢。

segments.en: Alright, so we have this word, drink fest.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有这个词，饮酒狂欢。

segments.en: Now, what is this fest part?
segments.cn: 那么，这个狂欢部分是什么？

segments.en: Well, maybe you recognize the word, Oktoberfest.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许你会想到Oktoberfest这个词。

segments.en: Ok, or festival.
segments.cn: 好吧，或者节日。

segments.en: So, fest is like a party.
segments.cn: 所以，狂欢就像一个派对。

segments.en: There's lots of food, there's lots of drink.
segments.cn: 有很多食物，有很多饮料。

segments.en: A drink fest is an event where there's a lot of drinks.
segments.cn: 饮酒狂欢是一个有很多饮料的活动。

segments.en: Ok, so can I have different types of fests?
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以有不同类型的狂欢吗？

segments.en: Yeah, this is a really informal sort of slang way of saying there's lots of something.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种非常非正式的俚语方式，表示有很多某种东西。

segments.en: So, I could say, oh my god, it's a puppy fest.
segments.cn: 所以，我可以说，哦我的天，这是个小狗狂欢。

segments.en: So, there are a lot of puppies.
segments.cn: 所以，有很多小狗。

segments.en: Or I can say like a fast food fest.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说像快餐狂欢。

segments.en: Ok, so you're eating a lot of fast food.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你吃了很多快餐。

segments.en: There's a lot of fast food.
segments.cn: 有很多快餐。

segments.en: Alright, so fest, interesting.
segments.cn: 好吧，狂欢，挺有意思的。

segments.en: Now, when he was describing his hangover, he said that he felt really nauseous.
segments.cn: 现在，当他描述他的宿醉时，他说他感觉非常恶心。

segments.en: Nauseous?
segments.cn: 恶心？

segments.en: Nauseous.
segments.cn: 恶心。

segments.en: Now, I always have a hard time spelling this word, so n-a-u-s, e-o-u-s.
segments.cn: 现在，我总是很难拼写这个词，所以是n-a-u-s，e-o-u-s。

segments.en: Nauseous.
segments.cn: 恶心。

segments.en: Nauseous.
segments.cn: 恶心。

segments.en: It kind of seems like you should say nauseous.
segments.cn: 这似乎应该说成恶心。

segments.en: Right, but... But you say nauseous.
segments.cn: 对，但... 但你说恶心。

segments.en: Yeah, ok, so when you're feeling nauseous, what do you feel like?
segments.cn: 是的，好吧，所以当你感觉恶心时，你感觉如何？

segments.en: So, you feel dizzy, you don't feel very well.
segments.cn: 所以，你感到头晕，感觉不太好。

segments.en: Like your stomach hurts.
segments.cn: 像是你的胃痛。

segments.en: Yeah, and your head is kind of spinning.
segments.cn: 是的，你的头有点晕。

segments.en: Ok, and you feel like you might throw up.
segments.cn: 好吧，你感觉可能会呕吐。

segments.en: Right, exactly.
segments.cn: 对，正是如此。

segments.en: Now, this word that you just mentioned, throw up, is actually our next word.
segments.cn: 现在，你刚提到的这个词，呕吐，实际上是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: And, well, we're not going to describe it.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们不打算描述它。

segments.en: Why don't we just listen to a person throwing up?
segments.cn: 为什么我们不听一个人呕吐呢？

segments.en: Oh, Marco, that was horrible!
segments.cn: 哦，Marco，那太可怕了！

segments.en: Well, that's the only way we could actually explain throw up.
segments.cn: 嗯，这就是我们解释呕吐的唯一方式。

segments.en: I mean, it's kind of a hard word to explain, but I'm sure everyone understands now what it means, right?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，这个词有点难以解释，但我相信每个人现在都明白它的意思，对吧？

segments.en: Ok, the word is to throw up.
segments.cn: 好吧，那个词是呕吐。

segments.en: To throw up.
segments.cn: 呕吐。

segments.en: To throw up.
segments.cn: 呕吐。

segments.en: Our next word, now our guy who's hungover, he said, I was so dehydrated.
segments.cn: 我们的下一个词，现在我们这个宿醉的家伙说，我脱水得很厉害。

segments.en: Dehydrated.
segments.cn: 脱水。

segments.en: To be dehydrated.
segments.cn: 脱水。

segments.en: So, this is an adjective, and it means that I have no water in my body.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一个形容词，意思是我体内没有水。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Ok, so, I am dehydrated.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以，我脱水了。

segments.en: I need water.
segments.cn: 我需要水。

segments.en: Common feeling after drinking too much beer, huh?
segments.cn: 喝太多啤酒后常见的感觉，是吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Now, our final word, he said he had a headache, and he said, My head's been pounding all day.
segments.cn: 现在，我们最后一个词，他说他头痛，他说，我的头一整天都在痛。

segments.en: Ok, so his head has been pounding all day.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以他的头一整天都在痛。

segments.en: Now, this verb, pounding, it sounds like this.
segments.cn: 现在，这个动词，痛，听起来是这样的。

segments.en: Alright,
segments.cn: 好吧，

segments.en: so, a clear example of what your head feels like when you have this very bad headache.
segments.cn: 所以，这是你头痛时的一个清晰例子。

segments.en: You can also say, I have a pounding headache.
segments.cn: 你也可以说，我有一个剧烈的头痛。

segments.en: I have a pounding headache, exactly.
segments.cn: 我有一个剧烈的头痛，正是如此。

segments.en: Or my head is pounding.
segments.cn: 或者我头在痛。

segments.en: Alright, so, five great words that we just looked at right now.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以，我们刚刚看了五个很棒的词。

segments.en: So, why don't we listen to our dialogue a second time.
segments.cn: 那么，我们为什么不再听一次对话呢？

segments.en: Let's slow it down just a little bit, and then we'll come back and take a look at some phrases.
segments.cn: 我们慢一点，然后再回来看看一些短语。

segments.en: Are you ok, man?
segments.cn: 你还好吗，兄弟？

segments.en: You don't look very well.
segments.cn: 你看起来不太好。

segments.en: I feel terrible.
segments.cn: 我感觉糟透了。

segments.en: I went out last night with Trevor, and things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 我昨晚和特雷弗出去，事情有点失控。

segments.en: Nice, so where did you guys go?
segments.cn: 不错，你们去了哪里？

segments.en: We hit up a couple of local bars and met up with some friends.
segments.cn: 我们去了几家当地酒吧，见了一些朋友。

segments.en: Everything was cool until Mike came along, and it turned out that it was his birthday yesterday.
segments.cn: 一切都很好，直到迈克来了，结果发现昨天是他的生日。

segments.en: Oh no!
segments.cn: 哦不！

segments.en: Mike's birthday is a drink fest for sure.
segments.cn: 迈克的生日肯定是个喝酒的节日。

segments.en: Tell me about it.
segments.cn: 说得对。

segments.en: We drank everything in the bar.
segments.cn: 我们喝光了酒吧里的所有酒。

segments.en: Is that why you missed work today?
segments.cn: 这就是你今天缺勤的原因吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I woke up this morning feeling really nauseous.
segments.cn: 是的，我今天早上醒来感觉非常恶心。

segments.en: I threw up like five times.
segments.cn: 我呕吐了大约五次。

segments.en: I was so dehydrated that I drank a gallon of water, and my head has been pounding all day.
segments.cn: 我脱水得厉害，喝了一加仑的水，我的头整天都在痛。

segments.en: I swear, I am never going to drink again.
segments.cn: 我发誓，我再也不喝酒了。

segments.en: Too bad, man.
segments.cn: 真可惜，兄弟。

segments.en: Tonight is Tracy's going away party, and she asked if you were going to go.
segments.cn: 今晚是特雷西的告别派对，她问你是否会去。

segments.en: Oh yeah?
segments.cn: 哦，是吗？

segments.en: I'm there.
segments.cn: 我会去的。

segments.en: Alright, well that was a little easier to understand this time.
segments.cn: 好吧，这次听起来稍微容易理解一些。

segments.en: Now, you mentioned that we've got some great phrases, so let's go to them now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在，你提到我们有一些很棒的短语，所以我们现在去看看它们。

segments.en: Fluency Builder Alright, so as we heard in the dialogue, the party was... I think it was a great party, right?
segments.cn: 流利表达 好吧，正如我们在对话中听到的，派对是……我觉得是个很棒的派对，对吧？

segments.en: Well, it sounds like it was fantastic.
segments.cn: 嗯，听起来确实很棒。

segments.en: Well, apparently it was a great party, and he said that he went out with Trevor, and things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 显然这是个很棒的派对，他说他和特雷弗出去，事情有点失控。

segments.en: Things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 事情有点失控。

segments.en: Right, so things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 对，所以事情有点失控。

segments.en: Now, to get out of hand.
segments.cn: 现在，失控是什么意思？

segments.en: What's that mean?
segments.cn: 嗯，我们有一些例子，所以在解释之前我们先听几个。

segments.en: Well, we have some examples, so let's listen to a couple of them before we explain it.
segments.cn: 例子1 亲爱的，孩子们有点失控了。

segments.en: Example 1 Honey, the kids are getting a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 你能做点什么吗？

segments.en: Can you do something?
segments.cn: 例子2 伙计们，这场争论失控了。

segments.en: Example 2 Guys, this argument is getting out of hand.
segments.cn: 大家冷静一下。

segments.en: Let's all calm down.
segments.cn: 例子3 昨晚的派对失控了。

segments.en: Example 3 The party last night got out of hand.
segments.cn: 邻居叫了警察。

segments.en: The neighbors called the police.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以当事情失控时，你失去了控制。

segments.en: Okay, so when things get out of hand, you lose control.
segments.cn: 正是如此，它们有点失控。

segments.en: Exactly, they get out of control, just a little bit maybe.
segments.cn: 是的，变得有点疯狂。

segments.en: Yeah, go a little crazy.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以事情有点失控。

segments.en: Alright, so things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 现在，这个的反义词是，一切都很好。

segments.en: Now, the opposite of this was, everything was cool.
segments.cn: 一切都很好。

segments.en: Everything was cool.
segments.cn: 所以，一切都很好。

segments.en: So, everything was cool.
segments.cn: 基本上，一切都没问题，一切都很放松，一切都很好。

segments.en: So basically, everything was okay, everything was relaxed, everything was going fine.
segments.cn: 正是如此，然后迈克来了，事情就有点失控了。

segments.en: Exactly, and then Mike came along and then things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 哦，那个迈克。

segments.en: Oh, that Mike.
segments.cn: 现在是我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: He was describing that Mike's birthday party was a drink fest, right?
segments.cn: 他在描述迈克的生日派对是个喝酒的节日，对吧？

segments.en: And then his friend agreed.
segments.cn: 然后他的朋友同意了。

segments.en: He said, tell me about it.
segments.cn: 他说，告诉我关于它的事。

segments.en: Tell me about it.
segments.cn: 告诉我关于它的事。

segments.en: Tell me about it.
segments.cn: 告诉我关于它的事。

segments.en: Now, what does this mean exactly when he says, tell me about it?
segments.cn: 现在，当他说，告诉我关于它的事，这到底是什么意思？

segments.en: Basically, it means, I completely understand.
segments.cn: 基本上，这意味着，我完全理解。

segments.en: I completely agree with you.
segments.cn: 我完全同意你。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So I could say, oh my god Marco, it's so hot outside today.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，哦我的天，马尔科，今天外面真热。

segments.en: Right, and I would say, I know, tell me about it.
segments.cn: 对，我会说，我知道，告诉我关于它的事。

segments.en: Right, so I'm saying, yeah, I agree with you, you are right.
segments.cn: 对，所以我在说，是的，我同意你，你是对的。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Very good, so these phrases, okay, so three great phrases that we just looked at.
segments.cn: 非常好，所以这些短语，好吧，我们刚刚看了三个很棒的短语。

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue for the last time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 让我们最后一次听我们的对话，然后再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Are you okay man?
segments.cn: 你还好吗，兄弟？

segments.en: You don't look very well.
segments.cn: 你看起来不太好。

segments.en: I feel terrible.
segments.cn: 我感觉糟透了。

segments.en: I went out last night with Trevor and things got a little out of hand.
segments.cn: 我昨晚和特雷弗出去，事情有点失控。

segments.en: Nice, so where did you guys go?
segments.cn: 不错，你们去了哪里？

segments.en: We hit up a couple of local bars and met up with some friends.
segments.cn: 我们去了几家当地酒吧，见了一些朋友。

segments.en: Everything was cool until Mike came along and it turned out that it was his birthday yesterday.
segments.cn: 一切都很好，直到迈克来了，结果发现昨天是他的生日。

segments.en: Oh no, Mike's birthday is a drink fest for sure.
segments.cn: 哦不，迈克的生日肯定是个喝酒的节日。

segments.en: Tell me about it.
segments.cn: 说得对。

segments.en: We drank everything in the bar.
segments.cn: 我们喝光了酒吧里的所有酒。

segments.en: Is that why you missed work today?
segments.cn: 这就是你今天缺勤的原因吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I woke up this morning feeling really nauseous.
segments.cn: 是的，我今天早上醒来感觉非常恶心。

segments.en: I threw up like five times.
segments.cn: 我呕吐了大约五次。

segments.en: Ew!
segments.cn: 哎呀！

segments.en: I was so dehydrated that I drank a gallon of water and my head has been pounding all day.
segments.cn: 我脱水得厉害，喝了一加仑的水，我的头整天都在痛。

segments.en: I swear, I am never going to drink again.
segments.cn: 我发誓，我再也不喝酒了。

segments.en: Too bad man.
segments.cn: 真可惜，兄弟。

segments.en: Tonight is Tracy's going away party and she asked if you were going to go.
segments.cn: 今晚是特雷西的告别派对，她问你是否会去。

segments.en: Oh yeah?
segments.cn: 哦，是吗？

segments.en: I'm there.
segments.cn: 我会去的。

segments.en: So it sounds like these guys sure like to go out and have a few drinks, don't they?
segments.cn: 所以听起来这些家伙确实喜欢出去喝几杯，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，正是如此。

segments.en: And I think this is a very common thing among young people, usually in the United States.
segments.cn: 我认为这在年轻人中是非常普遍的事情，通常在美国。

segments.en: After a day at the office or something, or even in Europe, they'll go to the pub, right?
segments.cn: 在办公室工作一天后，或者在欧洲，他们会去酒吧，对吧？

segments.en: But the thing is that in America and Canada, we're very careful about alcohol and young people, right?
segments.cn: 但问题是，在美国和加拿大，我们对酒精和年轻人非常谨慎，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: The legal drinking age in the most part of the United States is 21 years of age.
segments.cn: 美国大部分地区的法定饮酒年龄是21岁。

segments.en: And really many parents or families will never let their children drink alcohol until they're 21.
segments.cn: 事实上，许多父母或家庭会一直不让他们的孩子在21岁之前喝酒。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And also the laws that control alcohol, like for example on television, if you notice a TV commercial with a beer or a wine, you will never see the person actually drinking it.
segments.cn: 还有控制酒精的法律，比如在电视上，如果你注意到有啤酒或葡萄酒的广告，你永远不会看到人们实际在喝。

segments.en: It's illegal.
segments.cn: 这是违法的。

segments.en: Yeah, that's true.
segments.cn: 是的，这是真的。

segments.en: While in other countries it's okay, you'll see people drinking it and having fun.
segments.cn: 而在其他国家，这样是可以的，你会看到人们喝酒并享受乐趣。

segments.en: In these commercials they can only maybe put them close to their lips but not drink it.
segments.cn: 在这些广告中，他们只能把酒杯靠近嘴唇，但不能喝。

segments.en: Interesting.
segments.cn: 有趣。

segments.en: Another weird thing is that sometimes you might want to sit in your back garden or out on your porch and have a beer after work, right?
segments.cn: 另一个奇怪的事情是，有时你可能想在后花园或阳台上喝一杯啤酒，工作后，对吧？

segments.en: But in places it's totally illegal to do that.
segments.cn: 但在某些地方，这完全是违法的。

segments.en: You can't be outside with alcohol.
segments.cn: 你不能在外面喝酒。

segments.en: Right, you can't be seen drinking or you can't be on the sidewalk or on a bus drinking.
segments.cn: 对，你不能被看到喝酒，或者在走道上或公交车上喝酒。

segments.en: While in other places you can, right?
segments.cn: 而在其他地方你可以，对吧？

segments.en: You can just have a beer on the subway.
segments.cn: 你可以在地铁上喝啤酒。

segments.en: So it's a little bit different policies on alcohol control.
segments.cn: 所以在酒精控制政策上有些不同。

segments.en: What do you guys think about it?
segments.cn: 你们对此有什么看法？

segments.en: Do you think it's correct or do you think maybe it's a little bit too exaggerated?
segments.cn: 你认为这是正确的，还是觉得有点夸张？

segments.en: Come to our website, EnglishPod.com and tell us about it.
segments.cn: 来我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，告诉我们你的想法。

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you guys there and until next time.
segments.cn: 好的，我们下次见。

segments.en: Thanks for downloading and goodbye.
segments.cn: 感谢下载，再见。
